FuncDef:
The traffic policy command defines a traffic policy and displays the traffic policy view.
The undo traffic policy command deletes the traffic policy.
By default, there is a default traffic policy profile.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a traffic policy. The policy name cannot be the name predefined by the system, that is, default.
The value is a string of 1 to 127 case-sensitive characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure a traffic policy for a traffic classifier, you can run this command to define a traffic policy and apply the policy to interfaces.
Prerequisites
The traffic classifier and traffic behavior are configured.
Follow-up Procedure
The traffic classifier is bound to the traffic behavior in the traffic policy and the traffic policy is applied to interfaces.
Precautions
If a traffic policy is applied to an interface, you are not allowed to delete the traffic policy directly. You need to cancel the application of the policy on the interface before using the undo traffic policy command to delete the policy.
